detaileddescription.para: Constructs a default Vector4 setting it to a zero vector i.e. x=y=z=w=0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float x, const float y, const float z, const float w)
memberdef.name: Vector4

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a Vector4 from the x, y, z and w floats passed in.
Constructs a Vector4 from a 2d Point setting z=w=0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p, const float z, const float w)
memberdef.name: Vector4

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a Vector4 from a Vector2 setting z=w=0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector2 &v, const float z, const float w)
memberdef.name: Vector4

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a Vector4 from a Vector2 additionally setting the z and w components equal to z and w.
Constructs a Vector4 from a Vector3 setting w=0.
Constructs a Vector4 from a Vector3 additionally setting the w component to 0.
Copy constructor
Returns the dot product (a scalar value) of this vector and otherVector.
Returns the distance between two points represented by this vector and otherVector. The distance is defined as the length of the line segment between two points represented here with the vectors.
Returns true if this Vector4 is x=y=z=w=0, false otherwise..
Returns this vector's length (also known as the magnitude).
Returns the squared length of this vector.

This method normalises this vector. If this vector is a zero vector (i.e. where each component is 0) then it cannot be normalised and so nothing happens. A normlised vector (also called a unit vector) is one which still points in the same direction but has been scaled to have a length or magnitude of 1.

Returns a Vector4 that is a normalised version of this vector. This vector remains unchanged. If this vector is a zero vector (i.e. where each component is 0) then it cannot be normalised and a zero vector is returned instead. A normlised vector (also called a unit vector) is one which still points in the same direction but has been scaled to have a length or magnitude of 1.
Resets this Vector4 back to x=y=z=w=0.
Sets the x component of this vector.
Sets the y component of this vector.
Sets the z component of this vector.
Sets the w component of this vector.
Returns the x component of this vector.
Returns the y component of this vector.
Returns the z component of this vector.
Returns the w component of this vector.

Returns a Point object containing the x and y components of this vector while the z and w components are dropped. Note: Point uses integer precision so non-integer x and y coordinates will be rounded.
Returns a Vector3 version of this vector dropping the w component.
Returns a Vector2 version of this vector dropping the z and w components.
Adds the corresponding components of this vector and vector v together.
Subtracts the components of vector v from the corresponding components of this vector.
Multiplies each component of this vector by factor and returns a reference to this vector.
Multiplies the components of this vector by the corresponding components of vector v.
If divisor is not 0 then each component of this vector is divided by divisor, otherwise nothing happens. Either way a reference to this vector is returned.
Assignment operator assigns the component values of v to this vector.

Returns the dot product of vectors a and b (the length of the projection of b onto a, multiplied by the length of a). The dot product of the two vectors is the sum of the products of corresponding components which results in a scalar. The dot product of two vectors a and b is also equal to the cosine of angle theta between the two vectors placed tail to tail multiplied by the lengths of the vectors i.e. a.b = ||a||||b||cos(theta)
Returns the distance between two points. The distance is defined as the length of the line segment between two points represented here with the vectors.
Returns a Vector4 that is the result of adding the components of vector a and vector b.
Returns a Vector4 that is the result of subtracting the components of vector b from vector a. Note: vector subtraction is not commutitive so a-b does not always equal b-a
Returns a Vector4 object where each vector component of v has been negated.
Returns a Vector4 that has had each vector component of v multiplied by factor.
Returns a Vector4 that has had each vector component of v multiplied by factor.
Returns a Vector4 where each component of vector v has been divided by divisor. If divisor is 0 then a zero vector is returned instead.
Compares the two vectors and if each of the corresponding components are equal in value then true is returned, false otherwise.
Compares the vectors and returns true if a and b are not equal, false otherwise.
Allows an instance of Vector4 to be written to the ostream and returns a reference to the ostream.
Simply copiesthe components values from the source vector to the detination vector.
